plants.name: Crocus vernus
plants.description: A small perennial flowering plant that often emerges through late winter snow, heralding early spring. It produces cup-shaped flowers in vibrant purples, yellows, and whites.
plants.location: Temperate regions of Europe and North America
plants.funFact: Crocuses are among the first flowers to bloom, sometimes even snow canâ€™t stop them, making them a true symbol of spring's arrival.

plants.name: Prunus serrulata
plants.description: A deciduous tree famous for its spectacular groups of pale pink to white blossoms that create stunning floral displays in early spring.
plants.location: East Asia (Japan, Korea, China) and cultivated widely in temperate zones
plants.funFact: Cherry blossoms bloom for only about one to two weeks, and their fleeting beauty is celebrated in festivals such as Japanâ€™s Hanami.

plants.name: Protea cynaroides
plants.description: An iconic South African flowering shrub with large, dramatic flower heads resembling a giant artichoke, surrounded by colorful bracts.
plants.funFact: The King Protea is the national flower of South Africa and is known for its incredible drought tolerance and unique flower structure.

plants.name: Narcissus pseudonarcissus
plants.description: A bulbous perennial producing bright yellow trumpet-shaped flowers, commonly found blooming in woodlands and meadows in early spring.
plants.location: Europe, particularly western and central regions
plants.funFact: Wild daffodils have inspired countless spring festivals and poems symbolizing renewal and new beginnings.
